@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Client-side wrapper of a REST resource. Each instance represents a resource in terms of REST. A number of actions (usually HTTP methods) unique to the resource can be defined and invoked. A resource with its actions is configured declaratively by passing a resource description to the constructor, or programmatically using {@link #map}. Each action is associated to a route. A route is a combination of method, URL pattern and optional parameter constraints. An action is invoked by calling a method with the same name. When a URL pattern of a route contains positional parameters, those parameters must be passed when invoking the associated action. Also, constraints defined in the route must be satisfied. When an action is invoked, a request is configured according to the associated route, is passed the URL parameters, request body data, and finally send. What kind of request is send can be configured by overwriting {@link #_getRequest}. No constraints on the action's name or the scope of the URLs are imposed. However, if you want to follow RESTful design patterns it is recommended to name actions the same as the HTTP action. 

 var description = {
  "get": { method: "GET", url: "/photo/{id}" },
  "put": { method: "PUT", url: "/photo/{id}"},
  "post": { method: "POST", url: "/photos/"}
 };
 var photo = new qx.io.rest.Resource(description);

 photo.get({id: 1});


 photo.configureRequest(function(req) {
  req.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");
 });
 photo.put({id: 1}, {title: "Monkey"});


 photo.configureRequest(function(req) {
  req.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");
 });
 photo.post(null, {title: "Monkey"});

To check for existence of URL parameters or constrain them to a certain format, you can add a check property to the description. See {@link #map} for details. 

 var description = {
  "get": { method: "GET", url: "/photo/{id}", check: { id: /\d+/ } }
 };
 var photo = new qx.io.rest.Resource(description);

If your description happens to use the same action more than once, consider defining another resource. 

 var description = {
  "get": { method: "GET", url: "/photos"},
 };

 var photos = new qx.io.rest.Resource(description);
 photos.get();

Basically, all routes of a resource should point to the same URL (resource in terms of HTTP). One acceptable exception of this constraint are resources where required parameters are part of the URL (/photos/1/) or filter resources. For instance: 

 var description = {
  "get": { method: "GET", url: "/photos/{tag}" }
 };
 var photos = new qx.io.rest.Resource(description);
 photos.get();
 photos.get({tag: "wildlife"})

Strictly speaking, the photos instance represents two distinct resources and could therefore just as well mapped to two distinct resources (for instance, named photos and photosTagged). What style to choose depends on the kind of data returned. For instance, it seems sensible to stick with one resource if the filter only limits the result set (i.e. the individual results have the same properties). In order to respond to successful (or erroneous) invocations of actions, either listen to the generic "success" or "error" event and get the action from the event data, or listen to action specific events defined at runtime. Action specific events follow the pattern "<action>Success" and "<action>Error", e.g. "indexSuccess". NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
description {Map?} Each key of the map is interpreted as action name. The value associated to the key must be a map with the properties method and url. check is optional. Also see {@link #map}. For example: 
 { get: {method: "GET", url: "/photos/{id}", check: { id: /\d+/ }} }
@param.description:
Each key of the map is interpreted as action name. The value associated to the key must be a map with the properties method and url. check is optional. Also see {@link #map}. For example: 
 { get: {method: "GET", url: "/photos/{id}", check: { id: /\d+/ }} }

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when any request was successful. The action the successful request is associated to, as well as the request itself, can be retrieved from the event’s properties. Additionally, an action specific event is fired that follows the pattern "Success", e.g. "indexSuccess".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when request associated to action given in prefix was successful. For example, "indexSuccess" is fired when index() was successful.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when any request fails. The action the failed request is associated to, as well as the request itself, can be retrieved from the event’s properties. Additionally, an action specific event is fired that follows the pattern "Error", e.g. "indexError".

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when any request associated to action given in prefix fails. For example, "indexError" is fired when index() failed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Number of milliseconds below a long-poll request is considered immediate and subject to throttling checks.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Number of immediate long-poll responses accepted before throttling takes place.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A symbol used in checks to declare required parameter.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get placeholders from URL.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String} The URL to parse for placeholders.
@param.description: The URL to parse for placeholders.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} Array of placeholders without the placeholder prefix.
@return.description: Array of placeholders without the placeholder prefix.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get resource. May be overridden to change type of resource.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: description {Map?} See construct.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.bom.rest.Resource} Resource implementation which does the heavy lifting.
@return.description: Resource implementation which does the heavy lifting.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tailors (apply dependency injection) the given resource to fit our needs.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: resource {qx.bom.rest.Resource} Resource.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Configure request.

@param.name: @param

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get request. May be overridden to change type of request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Map action to combination of method and URL pattern. 

   res.map("get", "GET", "/photos/{id}", {id: /\d+/});

   res.get({id: "123"});

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to associate to request.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: method {String} Method to configure request with.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String} URL to configure request with. May contain positional parameters ({param}) that are replaced by values given when the action is invoked. Parameters are optional, unless a check is defined. A default value can be provided ({param=default}).
@param.description: URL to configure request with. May contain positional parameters ({param}) that are replaced by values given when the action is invoked. Parameters are optional, unless a check is defined. A default value can be provided ({param=default}).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: check {Map?} Map defining parameter constraints, where the key is the URL parameter and the value a regular expression (to match string) or qx.io.rest.Resource.REQUIRED (to verify existence).
@param.description: Map defining parameter constraints, where the key is the URL parameter and the value a regular expression (to match string) or qx.io.rest.Resource.REQUIRED (to verify existence).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Map actions to members.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to associate to request.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: method {String} Method to configure request with.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String} URL to configure request with. May contain positional parameters ({param}) that are replaced by values given when the action is invoked. Parameters are optional, unless a check is defined. A default value can be provided ({param=default}).
@param.description: URL to configure request with. May contain positional parameters ({param}) that are replaced by values given when the action is invoked. Parameters are optional, unless a check is defined. A default value can be provided ({param=default}).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: check {Map?} Map defining parameter constraints, where the key is the URL parameter and the value a regular expression (to match string) or qx.io.rest.Resource.REQUIRED (to verify existence).
@param.description: Map defining parameter constraints, where the key is the URL parameter and the value a regular expression (to match string) or qx.io.rest.Resource.REQUIRED (to verify existence).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invoke action with parameters. Internally called by actions dynamically created. May be overridden to customize action and parameter handling.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to invoke.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
params {Map} Map of parameters inserted into URL when a matching
  positional parameter is found.
@param.description:
Map of parameters inserted into URL when a matching
  positional parameter is found.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
data {Map|String} Data to be send as part of the request.
  See {@link qx.io.request.AbstractRequest#requestData}.
@param.description:
Data to be send as part of the request.
  See {@link qx.io.request.AbstractRequest#requestData}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set base URL. The base URL is prepended to the URLs given in the description. Changes affect all future invocations.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: baseUrl {String} Base URL.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Abort action. Example: 


   res.get({id: 1});
   res.get({id: 2});
   res.abort("get");

   var actionId = res.get({id: 1});
   res.abort(actionId);

@param.name: @param
@param.body: when string), or a single invocation of an action to abort (when number

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resend request associated to action. Replays parameters given when action was invoked originally.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to refresh.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Periodically invoke action. Replays parameters given when action was invoked originally. When the action was not yet invoked and requires parameters, parameters must be given. Please note that IE tends to cache overly aggressive. One work-around is to disable caching on the client side by configuring the request with setCache(false). If you control the server, a better work-around is to include appropriate headers to explicitly control caching. This way you still avoid requests that can be correctly answered from cache (e.g. when nothing has changed since the last poll). Please refer to XMLHttpRequest Caching Test for available options.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to poll.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: interval {Number} Interval in ms.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: params {Map?} Map of parameters. See {@link #invoke}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: immediately {Boolean?false} true, if the poll should invoke a call immediately.
@param.description: true, if the poll should invoke a call immediately.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.event.Timer} Timer that periodically invokes action. Use to
   stop or resume. Is automatically disposed on disposal of object.
@return.description:
Timer that periodically invokes action. Use to
   stop or resume. Is automatically disposed on disposal of object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Long-poll action. Use Ajax long-polling to continuously fetch a resource as soon as the server signals new data. The server determines when new data is available, while the client keeps open a request. Requires configuration on the server side. Basically, the server must not close a connection until new data is available. For a high level introduction to long-polling, refer to Ajax with long polling. Uses {@link #refresh} internally. Make sure you understand the implications of IE's tendency to cache overly aggressive. Note no interval is given on the client side.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action to poll.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} Id of handler responsible for long-polling. To stop
  polling, remove handler using {@link qx.core.Object#removeListenerById}.
@return.description:
Id of handler responsible for long-polling. To stop
  polling, remove handler using {@link qx.core.Object#removeListenerById}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get request configuration for action and parameters. This is were placeholders are replaced with parameters.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: action {String} Action associated to request.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: params {Map} Parameters to embed in request.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Map of configuration settings. Has the properties method, url and check.
@return.description: Map of configuration settings. Has the properties method, url and check.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override to adjust the throttle limit.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override to adjust the throttle count.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Map actions from description. Allows to decoratively define routes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: description {Map} Map that defines the routes.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Declare event at runtime.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Type of event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Destructs the Resource. All created requests, routes and pollTimers will be disposed.
